title: BP invests £3.9m in forestry firm to boost its green credentials
text:
Global energy titan BP is investing in a company that plants forests as part of a push to convince critics of its green credentials.

BP’s venture capital arm will hand over $5m (£3.9m) to boost the growth of Finite Carbon, which manages more than 40 forest projects across three million acres.

The oil company's bet on forest management comes as its industry tries to tackle climate change.

It follows a £10m carbon credit initiative launched by Shell in the UK which will see cash used to help fund the restoration of forests.

Nacho Gimenez, managing director at BP Ventures, said: “The conservation and restoration of forests is vital to combatting climate change.
